page.title: 10** HELEN'S BIRTHDAY **
page.content: I had a wash and as I got to the bottom of the stairs I saw that the postman had been. He had delivered eight cards. One was from my grandmother Tingle and another from my Grandma and Grandad Dunderdale with two pounds in. The others were from my Aunty Janeen who is 17, Uncle Stephen aged 21, Aunty Ivy sent me three pounds, Uncle Len, Aunty Margaret and cousin Toni, my Aunty Janeen and Uncle Sam and my two cousins Samantha and Simon. My Grandma Tingle came at night and we had a barbecue tea before I went to Youth Club. She gave me five pounds and a box of chocolates. The next Saturday I went to town and with my money I bought another jumper. This one was cream with blue, red and green stripes. I had a lovely day and some money left over. I didn't have a party {By Helen Dunderdale. Aged 12 St. James
